intro: Ruellia neolongifolius, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia neolongifolius thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
